qas.question: What did French police take from demonstrators?
Which newspaper reported that only the Chinese could express themselves?
Where was the only place the Tibetan flag could be held?
Who was the Minister of the Interior?
What did French law enforcement take from protesters?
Where was the only place Tibetan flags were permitted?
Who said the police acted on their own in taking the flags?
Who rendered a France 2 camera person unconscious?

context: French police were criticised for their handling of the events, and notably for confiscating <a0_0><a4_0>Tibetan flags<a4_0/><a0_0/> from demonstrators. The newspaper <a1_0>Libération<a1_0/> commented: "The police did so much that only the Chinese were given freedom of expression. The Tibetan flag was forbidden everywhere except on <a2_0><a5_0>the Trocadéro<a2_0/>.<a5_0/>" Minister of the Interior <a3_0><a6_0>Michèle Alliot-Marie<a6_0/><a3_0/> later stated that the police had not been ordered to do so, and that they had acted on their own initiative. A cameraman for France 2 was struck in the face by <a7_0>a police officer<a7_0/>, knocked unconscious, and had to be sent to hospital.
